ex.util.search
Class Lattice

java.lang.Object
  ex.util.search.Lattice
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConstrainedLattice
public class Lattice
extends java.lang.Object

Finds n-best optimal paths through a lattice of states using the viterbi algorithm.

search

public int search(State[] lattice,
                  int maxNBest,
                  java.util.List<Path> results)
Search the lattice for maxNBest highest-scoring paths and store them in results.

Parameters:
lattice - partially ordered states of the lattice to search
maxNBest - maximum number of paths to return

public int backtrack(State finState,
                     boolean terminateOnImpossible,

searches using precomputed forward probs until the first initial state is reached or, if terminateOnImpossible, until the first impossible state is reached

backtrack

public int backtrack(State finState,

findBestPathBetween

public int findBestPathBetween(GState[] states,
                               int iniStateIdx,
                               State finState,
                               java.util.List<Path> results)
Finds 1 best path by doing a forward step from iniState to finState and backtracking from finState to iniState. The path score excludes both iniState and finState scores. Returns 1 if the path was found and added to results, 0 when no path

backtrackSubLattice

public int backtrackSubLattice(State finState,
                               State iniState,
                               int maxNbest,
                               java.util.List<Path> results)
Finds n best paths by backtracking from finState to iniState. To be used only when it is guaranteed that all paths going back from finState also pass through iniState. Otherwise, the search is potentially exponential.

toGraph

public static java.lang.String toGraph(State iniState)

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
